alert.note: Alert for Goshen (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 25 at 3:30PM MST until January 25 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Western Scotts Bluff County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Northeastern Banner County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Southeastern Goshen County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 400 PM MST. * At 328 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Torrington to Terrytown, moving south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and trained spotter. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Locations impacted include... Scottsbluff, Gering, Terrytown, La Grange, Lyman, Huntley, Wildcat Hills State Recreation Area, Stegall, Wildcat Hills Campground, Scotts Bluff National Monument, Hawk Springs Campground, Hubbard Hill, Hawk Springs Recreation Area and Harrisburg. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
